column1: over the wicket, back of a length, pushed into the covers and they are away
good length at off stump, pushed to deep cover
there he goes! Brings out the scoop second ball, goes across outside off, takes this off the stumps over short fine leg
straight down the ground this time! Walked at the bowler, lofted it in the air straight of mid-on. Not quite timed perfectly but has enough
a bouncer, a slower ball one, loops over Harper's head...well bowled
off the back of the bat! Going for the scoop again, it's a slower ball, he's through his shot a little early and it loops towards short third man
over midwicket...Finch moves outside leg, Cook tried to follow him but served it up right in the slot
tucked to the leg side
on the sweep again! Moves across well outside off stump, powerfully sweeps behind square
in the air, straight down the ground...this is fantastic batting. Crisp footwork and a lovely strike through the line, into the sightscreen
uses his feet the calmly pushes down to long-on
worked off the stumps to midwicket...great start from the Renegades
back of a length, follows him as he moves outside leg, pushed to midwicket
full at the stumps, opens the face and pushes into point
another scoop, against a length ball, this one almost goes straight over the keeper but almost plugs in the outfield
again he's moving outside off, swings against a low full toss and misses
another one straight! That made a great sound off the bat. Didn't move quite as much this time, just a little to leg, allowed him to free his arms through a full delivery
full toss, just over mid-on...didn't get the timing this time but he's able to clear the ring
full at leg stump, clipped to midwicket
good length at the stumps, just a defensive push and mid-off is deep enough to allow the single
full outside off, square drives to point
walked across outside off to try and scoop again, it's a low full toss, he makes a late adjustment and nudges to the leg side
in the slot, over wide mid-on! Staying leg-side of the ball, allows him to strike through the line...but it was served up on a length
back of a length, nips back to take him high on the pad via an inside edge
over the wicket, very full, driven to mid-off
a bouncer outside leg, Harper pulls out of the shot and it goes through to the keeper
ends up almost off the cut strip outside leg, drives a fullish delivery into the covers...fifty up inside five overs
back of a length at leg stump, worked off the pads to square leg
another great shot, over mid-off this time...using his feet, giving himself room, and drives inside-out
gets the toe end on this one, aiming something expansive over the leg side, had exposed all his stumps, the ball runs into midwicket
taken at cover! Harper's fun is over. Looking to the leg side again, it's a slower ball, and takes the leading edge as the bat face closes. A simple catch
over the wicket, a touch too straight and slips into the pads, swept to short fine leg
round the wicket, nearly squeezes through, full and straight, Marsh aiming to the leg side
worked off the stumps through square leg
length ball outside off, angled behind point
full on the stumps, dabbed square into the covers
pushed down the leg side, an appeal for a catch but wide is given
fired in at the pads, flicked to square leg. Steady start from Green
low full toss at the stumps, driven to long-off
lovely delivery...angled across outside off, beats the edge as Marsh pushes at it
back of a length at off stump, opens the face and runs it to third man
low full toss, driven straight down the ground, splits long-on and long-off
keeping it very full, another full toss, this one is driven to the left of long-off
full and straight, pushed to long-on...a couple of quieter overs
full outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, square drives to point
full outside off, opens the face and dabs to short third man
there's some power from Finch...full outside off, he can release the levers and drag this over long-on
pushes a full delivery to the on side
finds deep midwicket! Was looking for another one down the ground but he dragged this, the bat twists and it comes off the toe end. Big moment for the Thunder. Finch whacks his pad as he walks off
short outside off, too much width, square cut through point, excellent placement
full at off stump, driven past a diving cover
round the wicket, full and straight, Cooper is right in front of the stumps as he works to midwicket
clipped down the ground to long-on
gives himself a touch of room and drives to cover
worked from full outside off to deep midwicket, a fumble in the deep but not costly
over the wicket, short of a length, shoveled to deep midwicket
full, slides into the pads, rebounds to the off side
outside off, cut to point
pushed down the leg side, misses the sweep but gets the wide call
length ball outside off, beats the edge as he drives
flicked in the air over midwicket
short outside leg, pulled to deep midwicket
that's outta here...dragged down short, he rocks back and pulls well back over deep midwicket
skids on outside off, pushed through quicker, Marsh plays over the top of it
width outside off, more excellent placement from Marsh as he cuts it wide of backward point
length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length, straight, pushed back to the bowler
fuller at off stump, chopped into point and they scamper the single. The Thunder probably won't mind Cooper keeping the strike
full and straight, reverse sweeps and finds short third man
short of a length outside off, he's deep in the crease and works it down to long-on
does very well here, nearly goes back onto the stumps! Takes the bottom edge, spins back towards the stumps and he's alert enough to knock it away
gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
whipped into midwicket
reverse sweeps again, connects nicely this time, in the air over short third man. That will take the pressure off him
round the wicket, angled into the pads, neatly flicked away and beats the short fine leg...poor ball on Tremain's return
full at off stump, driven to long-off
a slower ball, aiming for a yorker, slips down the leg side
gets it spot on this time, excellent yorker at 134kph, dug out to midwicket
and again, just outside off this time and Cooper does well to get a brace from it as he angles through backward point
a short ball outside off, Cooper is through the pull early and is beaten
low full toss at the stumps, swung to midwicket on the edge of the ring
full toss on the pads, only costs a single as he picks out deep midwicket
length ball down the leg side, not far from leg stump and he gets away with it
back of a length at off stump, aiming a big pull through the on side, gets a bottom edge into his pads
full toss outside off, bat twists and there's not much timing as he swings to the leg side
terrific catch! Nair holds on at deep backward square...Cooper scooped this from outside off, actually connected quite nicely but Nair was able to dive forward to hold on. Good field placement
full toss on the pads, lovely bit of timing as he flicks strongly to deep square. Spoils an excellent over
short of a length outside off, driven to deep cover
square drives out to deep point
full, angled into the pads, he falls over a touch as he aims to work to the leg side
works a straight delivery into midwicket
stays back and square drives to point, hits the fielder this time
and again, finds point as he square cuts...good stuff from Nair
over the wicket, nearly bowls him as he misses a slog sweep and it skims past off stump
full outside off, squirts off the outer part of the bat backward of point
round the wicket, pushed in with the angled, steps back and square drives to point
gets the yorker in, Marsh can only send it down the ground as the bottom hand comes off the bat
paddles a length delivery into the leg side
gets this one away, just a fraction too much width, this time he opts to go up and over backward point
down the pitch, this is a bit of a heave out to deep midwicket

fantastic catch at deep midwicket! Daniel Sams, that's a beauty. Marsh goes for the slog sweep, takes it from quite a way outside off, it's struck nicely and it's skimming towards the boundary before Sams gets across with a full length dive
very full, dug out into midwicket
short outside off, that's wonderful placement from Christian as he square drives through point
fuller, wider outside off, more nice placement as he drives this wide of long-off
short of a length, pushed to the covers so he keeps the strike
over the wicket, a wide yorker outside off, drilled to extra cover
a short ball, nicely swivels on the pull to deep square
gets some fortune here, swinging to leg against a full delivery, gets an inside edge past the stumps
yorker at off stump, driven firmly to extra cover...well bowled
back of a length outside off, strong square drive through point and wide enough for the sweeper for a second
full, wide outside off, driven to long-off and they hustle well for the second
full toss which he manages to loft over cover without much timing

superbly bowled! Gets the yorker in, takes Christian on the boot. It's an offspinning slower ball, almost dips a little under the bat. Excellent delivery. Follows his superb yorker against Cutting the other night
a short ball first up, pulled to deep midwicket
another slower ball, Webster as he wait on the shot as he uses his feet, tucks to the leg side
full outside off, opens the face and angles into backward point
full and straight, worked to long-on...terrific over from Sams
round the wicket, interesting tactic, full outside off, clubbed down to long-on
pushed across, a low full toss outside off, can only drag it to midwicket on the circle
gets it slightly wrong, over deep midwicket! A low full toss, Webster with a solid swing of the arms and it's comfortably into the stands
very wide outside off, he chases it and drives to deep cover...would have a got a wide for that
wide yorker outside off, takes an inside edge towards short fine leg
well bowled, wide outside off, skews into the leg side off the toe end
over the wicket, back of a length outside off, pushed to point
short outside off, mistimes into the covers off the back foot
well bowled! That's a lovely delivery, pushed across full outside off, some late movement as it shapes away to beat the edge
backs away to the leg side, it's short outside off and he can't reach it but not called wide as Khawaja gave himself so much room
straighter, short of a length, worked through midwicket
beaten again! Pushed up fuller, shapes away to go past the edge as Khawaja gives himself room to drive. That's a superb over
full and straight, worked into midwicket
short of a length at off stump, chopped into the pitch off the bottom edge
full at the stumps, skews off a thick inside edge towards fine leg
length ball outside off, dragged through midwicket. Made a clunk off the bat but travels all the way
full outside off, a slower ball, he drives and misses having again given himself a touch too much room
drives on the up, through the covers. Strong shot from Khawaja, it wasn't a bad ball, perhaps a touch too much width. He threw his hands into it
short of a length outside off, excellent placement as he square drives behind point and wide of third man
fuller, on off stump, timed nicely with an open face but well fielded at backward point by Christian
back of a length outside off, cut down to third man
an appeal for lbw as Khawaja gets a long way across, takes the thigh pad an bobbles past the stumps. Pitched outside leg stump
on leg stump, flicked to the leg side
back of a length at off stump, steers to point for another dot
crunched! Straight down the ground, Khawaja uses his feet and thumps this straight of mid-off
that's brilliant...shuffles across outside off then scoops a full delivery over short fine leg
short and wide outside off, goes up and over backward point...Gleeson struggling at the moment
good comeback as he beats the top edge with a back of a length ball that bounces a touch
full outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length, straight, cramps him for room a little and Hales pushes to mid-on
starts round the wicket, good length at the stumps, pushed to the covers
stays round the wicket to the left hander, a slower ball full outside off, played to the covers
over the wicket, length ball outside off, whipped through square leg
round the wicket, back of a length and straight, tucked to midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, flicked off the pads and there's a misfield at backward square which allows a second
short of a length outside off, takes the bottom edge to the on side
full outside off, driven to cover
walks down the pitch, plays with an open face to point
full outside leg, Khawaja also moving outside leg, flicked sweetly deep into the leg side and brilliant fielding by Wildermuth from deep square
short, wide outside off, Khawaja chases it and gets the wide call
short of a length at off stump, jumps a little and is pushed to the off side
shuffles outside leg well before it's delivered, clips a low full toss through midwicket. Khawaja slips turning for the second
full at the stumps, clipped to long-on and he hobbles the single
flat outside off, Khawaja cuts and misses
straighter, fairly short, pulled to deep square leg
square drives to deep cover...Hales has barely had any strike
wide outside off, maybe a googly, cuts to deep cover
good length outside off, Hales waits then opens the face into the covers
full at off stump, touch more air this time, worked to long-on. Nice start from Boyce
full at off stump, whipped to deep square
just back of a length, Hales deep in the crease, pulled to deep midwicket
fuller, at the stumps, no timing as he sends this to long-on. The bat face closed as he played the shot
well bowled, full at the stumps, a touch slower and almost beats Hales who just manages to adjust and block it
fuller, straight, clipped to deep midwicket
full outside off, excellent placement as he opens the face and drives wide of backward point...a much-needed boundary
full at the stumps, driven back to the bowler
opens the face and steers into the off side
misses a reverse sweep to a ball outside off
full at off stump, slog-swept to deep midwicket
full outside off, almost a straight slog-sweep to long-on where Christian fumbles
tapped into the covers
full on the pads, clipped to deep square
full outside off, driven to deep cover
poor ball, pushed well down the leg side
back of a length, straight, a slower ball, worked into midwicket. This time Hales slips in the crease
short of a length on the pads, pulled backward of square...excellent placement
full and straight, a whippish clip to long leg...takes Khawaja to a very good fifty
down the pitch and drives to long-off
full and straight, reverse swept very neatly out to backward point. Good work in the deep by Richardson
very full outside off, driven wide of long-off, does well to get two from a good delivery
slog-swept, just over deep midwicket! Takes this from full outside off, good placement and just enough distance
dragged down short, that's pressure, Khawaja rocks back and hammers a pull through midwicket
pitches this very full outside off, driven to deep cover
moves across to off stump then drags a sweep to deep square...Hales at a run-a-ball
over the wicket, pushes across outside off, Hales slashes and misses...lets out a cry of frustration
round the wicket, short outside off, Hales flashes and gets a thick top edge that flies fine of short third man
edged! Just wide of the keeper. Back of a length, throws his hands into a square cut and it just evades a diving Harper
slower ball, full outside off, dabbed to backward point
finds cover! Full outside off, doesn't quite get to the pitch, grabbed high above his head bu the captain
round the wicket, back of a length and straight, worked to the leg side
full outside off, nicely driven through the off side wide of the sweeper

great work on the deep square boundary to save six! Pulled away by Hales, Marsh takes the catch but knows he's near the rope. Throws the ball back in but can't give himself a second chance for the catch. Saved five runs, though!
back of a length, straight, thick inside edge to the leg side
full and straight, drills a drive to long-on
full outside off, driven into the pitch and it runs to cover
short of a length at off stump, angled into backward point
full on the toes, worked to deep square
placed very well through the off side, keeps them ticking over
clubbed down the ground to long-on
clips a full delivery to long-on
that's a strong thump down the ground, just clears his left leg and swings through the line of a full delivery
and now huge over deep midwicket! Brings out the slog sweep and that's a big swing in the match with 17 off the over

given lbw! Well, not sure about that. Back of a length, straight, seems to take him reasonably high. Maybe not, we'll need a replay. Was pretty close either way. Clipping the bails, so technically correct!
short of a length, straight, worked to mid-on
back of a length outside off, square driven to backward point
opens the face and guides this nice from outside off wide of third man
short of a length, this comes off the splice and is in the air for a while wide of backward point
back of a length at off stump, square drives and finds backward point
full at the pads, worked through midwicket to take him to a 33-ball fifty
full outside off, driven to deep cover
sends this miles into the night sky and over deep square leg, was a length ball angling in, Hales sweeps this off the medium pacer
oh dear, that's a horrid misfield! Hales moves outside leg, drives firmly to deep cover where Wildermuth lets it through his hands. Dew, but still a poor piece of work
he's doing it in style now, hammers a full delivery straight down the ground. A crunching stand-and-deliver blow
round the wicket, full at leg stump, that's fantastic power and placement as he picks the gap between long-on and deep midwicket with a thunderous bottom-handed whip
round the wicket, worked off the pads to deep square
taken at deep midwicket! He struck that so sweetly, but Richardson barely had to move. Gurney had come back over the wicket, it was full and straight, Hales just wanted to keep going
round the wicket, full at off stump, played to point
over the wicket, short down the leg side, an appeal for the catch but the wide is called. The bluff doesn't work
length ball outside off, square drives to deep cover
just short of cover! Round the wicket, a slower ball, takes the leading edge and lands just in front of cover. Lovely bowling
full outside leg stump, an appeal for lbw but zero chance of that...deflects away
oh, no, Harper can't get under swirling chance! Big top edge, loops miles into the sky and over the keeper. Not easy to judge but he got there, although didn't touch the gloves in the air. Tough one
plays and misses outside off
another dot ball as he drives and misses at a slower ball outside off...bit of pressure
full and straight, a strong whip through midwicket for a comfortable brace
full, wide outside off, but not too wide and Gilkes misses another drive
keeps it full and straight, worked to long-on. Excellent final over from Richardson. He's done his bit
round the wicket, big full toss on the pads, swings to the leg side and doesn't make contact...lucky to get away with that
over the wicket, another misfield, what a moment! Full outside off, he drives square and it's straight through the hands of Finch. Oh dear. Like his IPL, that's costly
slower ball, beats the top edge to the keeper
a yorker outside off, driven through the covers to the sweeper
slower ball, full outside off, a slower ball, calmly worked down the ground and excellent running, and the pace on the shot, allows the second
full outside off, driven to deep cover
over the wicket, full at the stumps, angled through backward point
fires a full ball down the leg side, that's what the Renegades didn't need
low full toss outside off, swung to long-on

has he been run out? Yes, well out! It was a short ball down the leg side, he missed the pull...Harper, who hurls his glove glove off, threw to the non-striker's end where Gleeson collected, then rolled the ball into the stumps. He's well short
hammered! That's the win Well, that takes away all the doubt. Full outside off and Ross crunches it straight down the ground
